page.title: 15GOTHENLY HALL
page.content: Gothelney Hall is a Grade 1 Listed Building.It is a very impressive fragment of a manor house.The evidence offered by the building has not been sufficiently investigated.The front has atwo storeyed porch to its one original staircase,and a tall embattled tower with a room on the top floor with a three-light window with perptracery.Behind the porch lay the hall,but in it,facing towards the porch side,is a large blank arch and a smaller by its side.Corresponding,on the outer back wall of the house is a very large arch.Was this at one time a gateway?The surviving range has a roof with arched braces on small angels and with cusped wind braces.The wooden doorway doorway from the upper floor staircase has the rare motif of fleurons in jambs and head.Drawing room has thin ribbed plaster ceiling
